item.title: Ada add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Ada add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Ada add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Ada add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet." -- Plato

item.title: Ada add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Ada add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ada add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I can resist anything except temptation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ada add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper, That we may record our emptiness." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Ada add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde
